title: How India’s Digital Public Infrastructure Is Rewriting Global Governance
desc: From UPI to ONDC and ABHA, India is building open rails that challenge platform monopolies and offer a new model of public digital infrastructure.
content:
India’s Digital Public Infrastructure (DPI) is quietly becoming one of the most important governance innovations of the 21st century. Unlike closed private platforms, DPI is designed as an open system of rails — where startups, citizens, and institutions can build and compete.

1) UPI: The Payment Rail That Changed Everything

UPI is more than a payment tool — it is a public protocol that allows banks, apps, and users to transact instantly. The key shift is interoperability: competition happens on user experience, not monopoly control.

2) Aadhaar: Digital Identity at National Scale

Aadhaar works as a foundational identity layer — enabling verification, reducing fraud, and powering large-scale service delivery. When paired with other rails, it reduces costs across the economy.

3) DigiLocker: A Paperless Governance Layer

DigiLocker makes documents verifiable, portable, and retrievable — enabling paperless workflows across institutions. It reduces transaction friction for citizens, students, and entrepreneurs.

4) ABHA: Health Records as Public Infrastructure

ABHA (health ID) is designed to make health information portable, standardized, and accessible across the ecosystem. The long-term effect is a health system that can scale efficiently while improving continuity of care.

5) ONDC: Rebuilding Commerce as Open Rails

ONDC is attempting to do for e-commerce what UPI did for payments: make it interoperable. If successful, it reduces dependency on centralized gatekeepers.

6) Open Credit & Account Aggregators

Open credit infrastructure is about improving access to capital — especially for MSMEs. When lending becomes faster and more data-driven, small entrepreneurs gain leverage.

Why This Model Matters Globally

The deeper story is not just technology — it is governance design. DPI creates a foundation where services scale nationally while enabling competition. Many countries may adopt similar frameworks as digital sovereignty becomes critical.
